Title: Microsoft Viva Copilot Analytics launches new agent dashboard
Summary: Microsoft Viva Copilot Analytics introduces a new Agent Dashboard for detailed insights on agent adoption and Copilot credit usage. Rolling out from November 2025 (preview) to February 2026 (general availability), it targets organizations with 50+ Copilot licenses, enhancing adoption tracking and management within Viva Insights.

Title: (Updated) Realtime voice is now available in M365 Copilot Chat and M365 Copilot
Tags: Updated message, New feature, User impact
Summary: Realtime voice chat is now available in Microsoft 365 Copilot, enabling hands-free, natural interactions for brainstorming, searching, and more. The feature rolls out worldwide starting September 2025, is on by default, requires no admin setup, and supports iOS, Android, Web, Windows, and Mac platforms.

Title: (Updated) SharePoint 2013 workflow retirement
Tags: Updated message, User impact, Admin impact, Retirement
Services: SharePoint Online, Microsoft OneDrive, Project Online
Summary: SharePoint 2013 workflows will be disabled for new tenants starting April 2, 2024, and fully retired for all tenants on April 2, 2026. Organizations must migrate to Power Automate or other solutions, notify users, and prepare support teams accordingly. No extensions will be offered beyond this date.

Title: (Updated) Azure ACS retirement in Microsoft 365
Tags: Updated message, User impact, Admin impact, Retirement
Summary: Azure ACS for SharePoint Online will retire on April 2, 2026. New tenants cannot use it after November 1, 2024. Organizations must migrate custom apps to Microsoft Entra ID for secure authentication and use the Microsoft 365 Assessment tool to identify Azure ACS usage.

Title: (Updated) SharePoint Framework domain isolated web parts retirement
Tags: Updated message, User impact, Admin impact, Retirement
Summary: SharePoint Framework domain isolated web parts will be disabled for new tenants starting April 2, 2025, and fully retired for all tenants by April 2, 2026. Organizations must update these web parts to regular ones before then, as they will stop functioning and show errors after retirement.

Title: (Updated) SharePoint Add-In retirement in Microsoft 365
Tags: Updated message, User impact, Admin impact, Retirement
Summary: SharePoint Add-Ins will retire on April 2, 2026, stopping their functionality. From July 1, 2024, they cannot be installed from the public marketplace, and new tenants lose all usage by November 1, 2024. Organizations should migrate to SharePoint Framework (SPFx) and prepare users and admins accordingly.

Title: Upcoming Secure by Default Settings Changes for Exchange and Teams APIs
Summary: Starting late October to November 2025, Microsoft will require admin consent for third-party apps accessing Exchange and Teams content via Microsoft-managed default consent policy. This enhances security by restricting user consent, affecting new app permissions but not existing approved apps. Admins should review app access and configure consent workflows accordingly.

Title: Retirement of "When Sending a Message" Group Policy in Classic Outlook for Windows
Summary: The "When Sending a Message" Group Policy in Classic Outlook for Windows will be retired by January 13, 2026. New individual policies will be introduced starting October 14, 2025, requiring admins to migrate and configure settings separately for more granular control.

Title: (Updated) Microsoft Teams: Collaborative Notes in Chats
Tags: Updated message, New feature, User impact
Summary: Microsoft Teams is introducing Collaborative Notes (powered by Loop) in group chats on desktop and web, enabling real-time co-creation of notes, agendas, and action items within chats. Rollout starts late September 2025 with general availability by late October. The feature is on by default and manageable via Teams Admin Center or PowerShell.

Title: (Updated) DNS Provisioning Change
Summary: Starting February 1, 2025, A records for new Accepted Domains will be provisioned under mx.microsoft instead of mail.protection.outlook.com to support DNSSEC adoption. Update any automation to use the List serviceConfigurationRecords Graph API for MX records by this date to avoid mail flow issues.
